result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Allic Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence now serving

superMiscConds.notes: $518 DOC Collect within 1st 6 months of being Released from Prison.   If E.S. is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Allic Hill

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release Date.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Charles Allic Hill in court in custody with attorney Joshua Klaff.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders: COUNT 3: 10 years bifurcated sentence: 5 years WSPrison, 5 years Extended Supervision; Consecutive to any other sentence now serving; Deft IS ELGIBLE for Programs; 0 days credit; DOC collect costs-to be paid within 1st 6 months of release from custody.
